revised_title: Sex Inversion and Serological H-Y Antigen in Sex Determination
tldr: This article discusses sex determination in vertebrates, focusing on sex inversion as a model for understanding the mechanisms of sex determination. It explores the role of serological H-Y antigen in primary gonadal differentiation and how it may be involved in the organization of the heterogametic gonad. The article also highlights the differences in sex determination mechanisms between placental mammals and non-mammalian vertebrates, and the importance of further research to better understand the genetics of sex determination in placental mammals.
